div.p: MS 13071 Royal Society of Victoria Exploration Committee records, box 2078/3, La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

On 12 March 1862 H. M. Sampson, who had been engaged by Alfred Howitt during his relief expedition to Cooper’s Creek, wrote to the Exploration Committee submitting his expenses of £27.3.6 for bringing the surviving camels from the Burke and Wills expedition from Menindie to Melbourne. Sampson also requested that his pay be increased from 8 January to the rate of that of a third officer viz £200 a year. M's minute is an annotation on Sampson's letter.
The honorary treasurer is requested to comply with the request of Mr Samson
